alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 28 at 2:26PM MST until February 28 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 6PM THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS, MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, AND SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO VERY WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY LATE MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EARLY EVENING FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO VERY WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS... .Dry and windy conditions will return on Wednesday afternoon across the east-central plains, allowing critical fire weather conditions to return for several hours. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING... Northeast Plains (Zone 104) from Tuesday late morning through Tuesday early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...12 to 17 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
